intro: Elaphoglossum stelligerum, commonly known as the mountain holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are typically covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its reproductive structures, known as sori, are clustered on the underside of the fronds and are protected by a kidney-shaped indusium. Elaphoglossum stelligerum is often found growing on rock surfaces or in forest understories, showcasing its adaptability to various microhabitats.
